title: Sandvika
text:
Sandvika () is the administrative centre of the municipality of <a href="B%C3%A6rum">Bærum</a> in <a href="Norway">Norway</a>. It was declared a <a href="List%20of%20cities%20in%20Norway">city</a> by the <a href="municipal%20council%20%28Norway%29">municipal council</a> in Bærum on 4 June 2003.
Sandvika is situated approximately west of <a href="Oslo">Oslo</a>. It is the main transportation hub for Western Bærum, and has a combined bus and <a href="Sandvika%20Station">railway station</a>. Sandvika is also one of the stops along the route of the <a href="Flytoget">Airport Express Train</a>. Sandvika also has Scandinavia's largest super mall, <a href="Sandvika%20Storsenter">Sandvika Storsenter</a>, with 190 stores and a total area of . On 13 March 2013, the previously pedestrianized main street was opened for car traffic and on-street parking.
Sandvika used to be home to the <a href="BI%20Norwegian%20Business%20School">BI Norwegian Business School</a>, which moved to new surroundings in <a href="Nydalen">Nydalen</a>, Oslo in August 2005. The building was, after some refurbishing, converted into the home of Sandvika High School.
Another school in Sandvika is Norges Realfagsgymnas NRG (Norwegian school of maths and science), a combined secondary school and high school. It lies in Skytterdalen and offers education in maths and science.
The nearby island of <a href="Kalv%C3%B8ya%2C%20B%C3%A6rum">Kalvøya</a> is a place for recreation. The Boat Sport House is located on Kalvøya, and is used by <a href="B%C3%A6rum%20KK">Bærum KK</a> and <a href="B%C3%A6rum%20RK">Bærum RK</a>. It also hosted one of the best known Norwegian music festivals <a href="Kalv%C3%B8yafestivalen">Kalvøyafestivalen</a>.
A small islet in <a href="Sandviksbukta">Sandviksbukta</a>, outside Sandvika, is called <a href="Danmark%20%28islet%29">Danmark</a>. <a href="Danish%20people">Danes</a> who live in the area join together every year on 5 June <a href="Denmark">Denmark</a>'s national day to celebrate. It has been debate on the Danish flag on "Danmark", but currently it still is there.
In art and music.
<a href="Claude%20Monet">Claude Monet</a> visited in early 1895. During his stay he painted several views of the town and the surrounding landscape, with the mountain ridge <a href="Kols%C3%A5s">Kolsås</a> featuring in many of the paintings either in the background or as the primary subject. Perhaps the most well known of the paintings from this visit is 'Sandviken Village in Snow' which features the Løkke bridge in the foreground with Kolsås in the background. The bridge still stands in Sandvika.
